cyclone.name: HAROLD
cyclone.current_location: about 375 miles ESE of Port Mansfield, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing quickly westward and expected to move inland over south Texas then weaken while moving farther inland
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south Texas coast near Baffin Bay/Port Mansfield

weather_observation.watch_coast: Port O'Connor to Sargent, TX (tropical-storm watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of Rio Grande to Port O'Connor, TX (tropical-storm warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South-central Texas coastline from the mouth of the Rio Grande north-eastward to roughly Sargent, TX
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts 20–30 mph possible in peripheral rain bands
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Beaumont’s section of the Upper Texas coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of light to moderate rain (1–2 inches) possible late Tuesday into Wednesday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Stronger rip currents along Upper Texas Gulf beaches
